column5: praying for you Jack, be well.
That's the kind of attitude that can beat this thing.  Give it hell Jack.
Jack, your family here is a lot bigger then you know... your attitude is great. keep fighting and dont give up. we are all praying for you...

I first met Jack several years ago at Beans and Maribeth's house on Pigeon Lake. It was a great visit and I had a wonderful time with the likes of Big Cliff, Pigeon Fisher, Lew and of course Jack. Well, on the 7th of this month I received an email from Jack which read:  Hi Roy, Been having a problem with backaches since  mid January. I mentoin this to my Eurologist, who immediately sent me for a  Catscan.It shows that my Cancer is on the move again and got into my Pelvic and  lower backbone. Hence the aching.Apparently it built up an immunity to the drug  I've been having for 2 yrs. Apparently, people with this kind of cancer have an  average of 2-3yrs as there is no cure as yet. I go for a bonescan on Mon. then on to chemo to  slow it down a bit. Sorry to load you up with this, but thought I'd let  you know befor the 'grapevine' started up LOL, Hope all is well at your end, see you at  L'air. Jack  I didn't post this to the board out of respect for Jack and Jackie's need for privacy. I've since been forwarded an email from Beans (Norm) and here it is:  Norm, I dont mind who you want to tell about me, the more it's in the open the easier to handle. Never did like secrets LOL. I was going to put it on the 'Board, but  did'nt want anyone think i'm looking for sympathy. Ah well, crap happens. As an update; after reading up on Chemo and getting lots of info from the hospital, I've [we] have decided NOT to go thro' with the Chemo. I'm told it wont cure it, only slow it down. With all the negatives, destroying good blood cells, open to any infections going around, weakness, tiredness [ sounds like HIV dont it] and on a 3 week cycle for the rest of my natural, we dont think its worth it. Sooner live a short time having fun, than a bit longer being miserable. There is another Hormone treatment thay we have to talk with the Doctor about, so we will go from there. Not the best of new's but we will make the best of it. Will you pass this along to Cliff as he wants to be kept up to date. Cant wait for the soft water fishing to start again TTYL.........Jack  So, whether you know Nanook or not, please, please offer a prayer to help him and Jackie get through this. If you don't pray, no worries, a positive thought will go a long way to making things better for them.  Jack, please know that I will help in any way I can to help you through this. I'm having trouble with words here Jack. Just know that your extended family will do what they can.  Be well.  Roy  And yes, I WILL see you at Lakair in June.
Best of luck Jack, you've got alot of buds here pulling for ya !!
Good luck Jack; looking forward to your next fishing report!
What Roy said. I look forward to seeing you then.
Regardless of what the so called experts say it can be beaten. Looking forward to your next fishing report as well!
Yes, what Solo said ! Hope to see you at Lakair  again Jack.

I dont know Jack, but im always there to wish positive things in the direction of those who need it. A prayer has been sent. He sounds like such an easy spirit in his e-mail.........that'll go a long way in itself to help
Tons of positive thoughts here for ya.
You're a brave man to take the high road Jack !  My father did the same.. quality over quantity...  Keep carving out them beauties fella !
Will be channeling all my positive thoughts your way Jack.  See you in June, and chin up bud!  Joey
My thoughts are with you Jack!!
Thoughts are with you, see you at LAKAIR
All my best Jack and we'll be sure to offer up our prayers for you.

Jack, We have never met, but yet I feel I do know you if even just a little through your posts and such. My good thoughts and well wishes come your way as well. Take care and kick the crap out of this thing!  Regards, Brian
All my best Jack. See you at Lakair.

Jack I support your decision no matter which way you go. As you know if their is anything you want or need you have my # please use it. I will see you at Lak Air and yes their is a place in my boat for you.   Art
Our prayers are with you, Jack.
Pulling for you Jack!
best of luck dude
Prayers for Nanook and mrs nanook
Thoughts and prayers are with you Nanook..... good luck to you. Leechman

I was a little shook up when I got his e-mail last week.Ihave had the pleasure of meeting Jack as well as having him carve a unicorn for my mothers birthday a couple of years ago.What talent he has!Prayers were said at Harmony United Methodist church last Sunday and they will continue for him.Looking forward to seeing Jack at the GTG again.Looks like he has a spot for th pike tourney and that boat has done very well over the last few years!Best wishes my friend! Joe

I know what you mean Joe...What with my buddy Cliff's good news and this about my pal Jack, I,m at a loss for words so I'll just keep conversing with my higher power for help for both of them...for now...

WOW !!! I'm overwhelmed, thanks to you all for your good wishes and support. When I get over this choked up feeling, I'll be feeling better than ever. It was a big decision not to have Chemo, but with all your support, Im gonna kick this thing in the I'm feeling pretty good right now, still doing some carvings. In fact I'm going into a show 27March in Brooklyn [Ont] Now to get my fishing tackle sorted and go get some Crappie with Beans, and then on to the Pike at L'air Jackie sends her thanks along with mine, with a family like this behind you, you cant go wrong.  Jack
kick its ass Nanook. Best of luck, thoughts will be with you
